title.rendered: National Finals Rodeo Bronc Riding: Everything You Need to Know

content.rendered:
Summary

  • Saddle Bronc Riding
  • Contestants Standings: Top 20 Player

The Wrangler National Finals Rodeo is recognized as the most lucrative and well-known rodeo in the world. Fans may watch modern cowboys rope and ride in this one-of-a-kind performance.

Let’s discuss everything you need about National Finals Rodeo Bronoc Riding.

Saddle Bronc Riding

  • It is very similar to Bareback Riding. In this riding method, the cowboy must hold on to the bucking horse for at least 8 seconds. If a rider cannot stay in the horse for 8 seconds, this will be a no-score ride.
  • The cowboys participating in this will be scored 1-50, depending on their performance. The horse will also earn points depending on their performance. The horse receives more points if it bucks in various directions to make it interesting rather than simply straight ahead.
  • In December, 15 of the top saddle bronco riders compete in the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo in Las Vegas. Top players will earn honor and millions of dollars in purses.
  • Alongside other NFR events, this will hugely impact Las Vegas’s economic condition.

Contestants Standings: Top 20 Player
